items.item_details:
The Board of Trustees offers an opportunity for the public to address the Board in four sections of the agenda: on matters of concern about Closed Session items; on matters not appearing on the agenda; on action items contained in the Consent Agenda; and prior to voting on any item contained in the Action Agenda. Each speaker is encouraged to submit a comment card to the Board clerk in order to be recognized to speak.
	Per Board Policy, three minutes may be allotted to each speaker with a maximum of 30 minutes per subject. No action or discussion shall be undertaken on any public comments except that members of the Board or its staff may briefly respond to or ask a question for clarification regarding statements made or questions posed by persons addressing the Board under this agenda item.
	For information and disability access to materials, call 408-270-6402. Meetings are held in a location accessible to the disabled.

items.item_details:
Per the collective bargaining agreement between the Faculty Association AFT 157 and San Jose/Evergreen Community College District Article 9.20 submission and recommendation: Adjunct faculty members shall be responsible and accountable for all District assigned service during the college semester for which they are employed. Assignments are limited to a maximum of 67% of the full load.
	 
Article 9.20 ASSIGNMENT LENGTH AND MAXIMUM LOADING - Adjunct faculty members shall be responsible and accountable for all Districts assigned service during the college semester for which the y are employed. Assignments are limited to a maximum of 67% of a full load.   
Therefore, the attached information is in compliance with Article 9.20 of the Faculty Association AFT 6157 Collective Bargaining Agreement with San Jose/Evergreen Community College District.
	 
Per the collective bargaining agreement between the Faculty Association AFT 6157 and San Jose/Evergreen Community College District  Article 15.2.1 submission and recommendation:
	 
Article 15.2.1 Full-time unit members' overload assignment  for compensation and/or overload banking shall be based on a separate contract which shall normally be limited to 6 (six) units or 40% of a full load. Exceptions to this maximum overload shall be negotiated with the Faculty Association.
Therefore, the attached information is in compliance with Article 15.2.1 of the Faculty Association AFT 6157 Collective Bargaining Agreement with San Jose/Evergreen Community College District.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the faculty personnel action as submitted.

items.item_details: The District employs non-bargaining unit employees in various categories to support programs and services.  These categories are: short-term assignments with limitations as defined in the CSEA/District collective bargaining agreement; substitutes to fill positions for employees on leave of absence or in vacant positions; professional experts with specialized knowledge or expertise not generally required of, or found within, the employee classifications established by the Governing Board; and athletic support staff for athletic activities.

items.item_details:
On April 12, 2011 the Board agreed to enter into an agreement with SunPower Corporation, Systems to provide a photovoltaic solar array at Evergreen Valley College.  As a result of that approval, the District secured reservation of a PG&E CSI incentive through January 20, 2012.  The formal contract with SunPower, approved by the Board on June 14, 2011, included the necessary Substantial Completion date of January 20, 2012.
	 
Subsequent to these approvals, the College chose to increase the total output of the solar array system from 1.0 megawatts to 1.4 megawatts.  The added volume of work necessitated a request to extend the CSI reservation, which was granted by PG&E through July 18, 2012. 
	 
The Board is requested to approve the following no-cost time extensions to the SunPower contract: 
1. Change the Substantial Completion Date from January 20, 2012 to March 30, 2012.
2. Change the Final Completion Date from April 20, 2012 to June 13, 2012. 
	 
SunPower has agreed to the terms of this change.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve a no-cost time extension as a change in contract scope with SunPower for the photovoltaic system at Evergreen Valley College.
items.item_text: SunPower Change Order #5: No-Cost Time Extension
items.item_text_raw: 7. SunPower Change Order #5: No-Cost Time Extension

items.item_details:
In November 2011, the Board approved an update to the Evergreen Valley College and San Jose City College Master Plans that identified the renovation of the existing football (SJCC) and soccer (EVC) fields. The District issued a Request for Proposal (RFP) for Professional Design Services for these projects. 
	 
The RFP process required a detailed qualifications submittal and a separate envelope for each respondent's fee proposal (a lump sum programming fee and a percentage of construction cost for all other services).  In response to the District's RFP, five (5) proposals were received on January 10, 2012. Responding firms were:
	 
Bellinger Foster Steinmetz
NTD Architecture
Polytech Associates
WLC Architects
Verde Design
	 
A panel comprised of District, College, and Gilbane personnel reviewed each RFP response and scored them based on specific selection criteria. The firms ranked as follows based on their selection criteria value score:
	 
1) Bellinger Foster Steinmetz - 164 points
2) Verde Design - 160 points
3) Polytech Associates - 118 points
4) NTD Architecture - 111 points
5) WLC Architects - 107 points
	 
Following the score ranking, the fee proposal envelopes were opened. Based on the combination of their value score and fee proposal, the firms were ranked as follows:
	 
1) Bellinger Foster Steinmetz
2) Verde Design
3) Polytech Associates
4) WLC Architects
5) NTD Architecture
	 
Contract negotiations were completed with Bellinger Foster Steinmetz and final terms agreed with District legal counsel. The contract includes a Standard Form of Agreement that identifies the specific scope of work of the SJECCD Athletic Fields Renovations project.
	 
Attachments:
A/E selection criteria value score summary
Standard Form of Agreement
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the Design Services Agreement for the Evergreen Valley Soccer Field Turf Replacement to Bellinger Foster Steinmetz Landscape Architecture in the amount of $19,050.
items.item_text: Design Services Agreement for Evergreen Valley College Soccer Field Turf Replacement
items.item_text_raw: 8. Design Services Agreement for Evergreen Valley College Soccer Field Turf Replacement

items.item_details:
Non-resident Tuition Rate:
	 
Education Code Section 76140 requires each district's governing board establish the non-resident tuition rate by February 1st for the succeeding year.  Education Code Section 76140(e) enumerates seven options for a district to choose in establishing the rate:
	 
Option One:  Statewide average, which is currently $179 per unit.
Option Two:  District average, which is calculated at $179 per unit.
Option Three:  N/A as the District does not have 10% or more non-credit FTES.
Option Four:  No more than a contiguous district.  West Valley Mission = $204 per semester unit; Ohlone = $203 per semester unit; and Foothill DeAnza = $123 per quarter unit.
Option Five:  No more than the district average and no less than the statewide average, which is $179 per unit.
Option Six:  Highest years statewide average, which is $190 per unit.
Option Seven:  No more than 12 comparable states' average, which is $331 per unit.
	 
The District's current non-resident tuition rate is $199 per unit.  In Fiscal Year 2010-2011, the District realized $1,054,408.  Staff recommends maintaining the rate at $199 per unit per Option Seven.
	 
Capital Outlay Fee:
	 
Education Code 76141 allows for a district to charge a capital outlay fee to any non-resident student.  The amount of the fee has to be the lesser of the amount that was expended by the District for capital outlay per FTES per unit in Fiscal Year 2010-2011, calculated at $19 per semester, or 50% of the FY 2012-2013 Non-resident tuition rate, calculated at $99.50 per semester.
	 
The District's current capital outlay fee is $25 per semester.  In Fiscal Year 2010-2011, the District realized $17,375.  Staff recommends reducing the fee to $19 per semester.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the non-resident tuition rate of $199 per unit and the capital outlay fee of $19 per semester for academic year 2012-2013.
items.item_text: Non-Resident Tuition Rate and Student Capital Outlay Fee for Academic Year 2012-2013

items.item_details: SJCC Health Services, in partnership with the Santa Clara Public Health Department and Breathe, CA, includes in one of its goals, to reduce secondhand smoke exposure on college and university campuses by promoting new and stronger smoke-free policies. The grant award of $5,000 will be used toward achieving those goals with counseling, educational materials and aids.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees accept $5,000 grant to SJCC Health Services for partnership to promote tobacco-free Santa Clara County from Breathe California. Funds will be used towards tobacco cessation activities including, counseling, educational materials and aids.
items.item_text: Acceptance of $5,000 grant from Breathe California to SJCC Health Services.
items.item_text_raw: 10. Acceptance of $5,000 grant from Breathe California to SJCC Health Services.

items.item_details: The Child Consortium Grant benefits Early Childhood Education students, grants flow through Yosemite Community College District.  We have had this grant for the last ten years.  Students are reimbursed for cost of tuition for Early Childhood Education courses and if they have Financial Aid they are reimbursed for the textbooks upon receiving a passing grade in the Early Childhood Education classes.

items.item_details:
On November 8, 2011, the Board of Trustees formally approved a workplan, including projects and deadlines to address ten priority areas that emerged directly from the Board's Self Evaluation Process.  The ten priority areas were further subdivided in two parts:  Workplan A- included priority areas in direct response to Accreditation findings also known as the "Shared Recommendations"  and Workplan B, which  focused on additional issues areas that emerged from the evaluation survey.  The ten priority areas are detailed in the attached Workplan/Dashboard.
	 
The purpose of this item is to provide a brief update on the status of the workplan and to recommend the formal establishment of a committee of the Board to develop an ongoing implementation and monitoring procedure to ensure that the timelines and goals are met.  This committee would work with the Chancellor to identify districtwide work that advances Board priorities and, in addition, will recommend activities to be undertaken by board members in their work with community constituents to contribute to the success and completion of the workplan.
	 
	 
The Workplan/Dashboard is included on the District's Website.  In addition, for ease of access, a pdf file is attached to this item.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees accept the updated Workplan presented by staff and formally establish a subcommittee of the board to work with the Chancellor on the monitoring and implementation of the Workplan/Dashboard.
items.item_text: Board's Workplan/ Dashboard Update and Proposed Monitoring Process
items.item_text_raw: 1. Board's Workplan/ Dashboard Update and Proposed Monitoring Process

items.item_details:
Pursuant to California Education Code 84040, the governing board of each community college district shall provide for an annual audit of all funds, books, and accounts of the district in accordance with regulations of the board of governors.  The audit shall be made by certified public accountants licensed by the California Board of Accountancy.
	 
Administrative Procedure 6400 requires the identification of all expenditures by source of funds and shall contain a summary of audit exceptions and management recommendations, which are to be presented to the Board of Trustees.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees accept the San Jose Evergreen Community College District Fiscal Year 2010/2011 Independent Annual Financial and Audit Report conducted by Crowe Horwath, LLP.
items.item_text: San Jose Evergreen Community College District Fiscal Year 2010/2011 Independent Annual Financial and Audit Report
items.item_text_raw: 2. San Jose Evergreen Community College District Fiscal Year 2010/2011 Independent Annual Financial and Audit Report

items.item_details:
Pursuant to California Education Code 84040, the governing board of each community college district shall provide for an annual audit of all funds, books, and accounts of the district in accordance with regulations of the board of governors.  The audit shall be made by certified public accountants licensed by the California Board of Accountancy.  Additionally, the ballot measure approved by the voters in November 2004 requires an annual financial and performance audit.
	 
Administrative Procedure 6400 requires a summary of audit exceptions and management recommendations, which are to be presented to the Board of Trustees.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees accept the San Jose Evergreen Community College District Fiscal Year 2010/2011 2004 General Obligation Bonds (Measure G - 2004) Independent Annual Financial and Performance Audit Reports conducted by Crowe Horwath, LLP.

items.item_details:
This study session is designed to update the Board of Trustees on the status and progress of the Measure I-1998 and Measure G-2004 Bond Programs and to highlight the progress of implementation activities for the Measure G-2010 Bond Program.
	 
The Agenda has been structured in the following format:
	 
1.  History and Background (Cepeda- 5 minutes) 
-Measure I – 1998-2004 
-Measure G – 2004
-Measure G – 2010
-Lessons Learned; January 25, 2011 Study Session
  2. Current Status (Smith- 5 minutes)
  3. Measure G-2010 Bond Management Team (Smith- 2 minutes)
  4. Roles & Responsibilities (Smith- 5 minutes)
  5. Proposition 39 (Smith/ Kennedy- 5 minutes)
  6. Master Planning (Nelson- 3 minutes)
  7. Local College Process (Nelson/ Gee- 10 minutes)
  8. Construction Careers Program (Miller- 5 minutes)
  9. Outreach Program (Miller- 5 minutes)
10. Program and Project Controls (Jewell- 10 minutes)
    11. Questions & Answers
